required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells for Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells for Ischemic Stroke (UMSIS): a Prospective, Double-blinded, Randomized Controlled, Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

brief_summary.textblock: This is a doble blind, placebo controlled clinical trial to assess safety and efficacy of intravenous administration of Umbilical cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem cells in patients with ischemic stroke within 6 months of onset.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two different treatment groups; intravenous umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stem cells or intravenous placebo solution
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Treatment and placebo solutions have identical appearance. Protocols will be designed to ensure that the physician evaluating patient safety and efficacy outcome as well as laboratory analysis, will not have access to the randomisation codes.

primary_outcome.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome
Fugl-Meyer Assessment Scale ranges from 0 to 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in Purdue hand function test
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of fine motor function were evaluated by Purdue hand function test

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in box and block test
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of fine motor function were evaluated by box and block test
the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in the national institutes of health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondary_outcome.description: NIHSS ranges from 0-42, and high NIHSS means bad outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in Mini-mental State Examination (MMSE) score
changes in Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score

secondary_outcome.description: serum biomarkers included CPEC, VEGF, BDNF, MMP-9

arm_group.description: intravenous umbilical cord derived mesenchymal stem cells
intravenous placebo solution with the same appearance as the treatment group.

intervention.description: umbilical cord derived mesenchymal stem cells were intravenously injected in a single dose of one hundred million.
intravenous placebo solution with the same appearance as the treatment group.

overall_official.affiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

facility.name: Department of Neurology, General Hospital of Northern Theater Command

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region
